--- title: "Tidyverse" author: "Ramprasath" --- ----------------------------------------- #Sales Analysis, Tidyverse Challenge ----------------------------------------- # Libraries Load the following libraries. ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_0da282c27e79af3cdce9c7327a5b9478'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr 1.1.2 ✔ readr 2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.2 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.2 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr 1.0.1 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(readxl) ``` ::: # Import Files ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_fc352c7104252541022dbd8a5ae216d7'} ```{.r .cell-code} bikes_tbl <- read_excel(path = "./../../00_data/01_raw_data/bikes.xlsx") orderlines_tbl <- read_excel("./../../00_data/01_raw_data/orderlines.xlsx") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> New names: #> • `` -> `...1` ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bikeshops_tbl <- read_excel("./../../00_data/01_raw_data/bikeshops.xlsx") ``` ::: #joining data ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_f89a769f25f3c223e517637efcb32ba0'} ```{.r .cell-code} bike_orderlines_joined_tbl <- orderlines_tbl %>% left_join(bikes_tbl, by = c("product.id" = "bike.id")) %>% left_join(bikeshops_tbl, by = c("customer.id" = "bikeshop.id")) ``` ::: #wrangling data ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_ede5b558cfbe4ba7ed8ca09cb004d3c0'} ```{.r .cell-code} bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl <- bike_orderlines_joined_tbl %>% separate(col = location, into = c("City","State"), sep = ",") %>% mutate(total.price = price * quantity) %>% select(-...1,-gender) %>% select(-ends_with(".id")) %>% bind_cols(bike_orderlines_joined_tbl %>% select(order.id)) %>% select(order.id, contains("order"), contains("model"), contains("category"), price, quantity, total.price, everything()) %>% rename(bikeshop = name) %>% set_names(names(.) %>% str_replace_all("\\.", "_")) ``` ::: # Manipulation of data (sales by state) ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_0a1ec8e981a66a3cc6ddb4350f3d25c1'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(lubridate) sales_by_state_tbl <- bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl %>% select(State,total_price) %>% group_by(State) %>% summarize(sales = sum(total_price)) %>% mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(sales, big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) sales_by_state_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: # Visualize sales by state data ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/plot_dc4aeb03ebfc67a7b373ac6f05dafc5e'} ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_state_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = State, y =sales)) + geom_col(fill = "#2DC6D6") + geom_label(aes(label = sales_text)) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) + labs( title = "Revenue by State", subtitle = "State wise trend of sales", x = "", # Override defaults for x and y y = "Revenue" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01_tidyverse_files/figure-html/plot-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: #Manipulate sales by state and location data ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_eb8f16e7c70a8fb3e7332b4634b0c811'} ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_year_state_tbl <- bike_orderlines_wrangled_tbl %>% select(order_date,total_price,State) %>% mutate(year = year(order_date)) %>% group_by(year,State) %>% summarise(sales = sum(total_price)) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(sales_text = scales::dollar(sales, big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'year'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_year_state_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: # Visualize sales by state data ::: {.cell hash='01_tidyverse_cache/html/plot2_6a8e4f37d9f619fb6c86d6cc9d8ca518'} ```{.r .cell-code} sales_by_year_state_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = year, y = sales, fill = State)) + geom_col() + facet_wrap(~ State) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format(big.mark = ".", decimal.mark = ",", prefix = "", suffix = " €"))+ labs( title = "Revenue by year and state", subtitle = "Each state different sales trend", fill = "State" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](01_tidyverse_files/figure-html/plot2-1.png){width=960} ::: :::
